page.title: 04 BRICK AND FLINT
page.content: Brick & flint is both functional & decorative.Once used because it was a {free local stone,}it is now chosen to add character.Flintwork patterns,often diamond,rectangular or square,are part of 9"brickwork in old houses & can form the front layer of a cavity wall in new. In the 1920's farmers paid women 6d a bushel for stone-picking.Piled flints in field corners are still used in building-these are best because they are weathered & of a suitable size. Flint quarried locally has to be {napped }ie. cut to hand-size with a flat face. Flintwork needs great skill in laying.Mortar,previously only lime & sand,is now mixed with cement.Three new cottages with flintwork are being built in Beacon's Bottom.Materials from old buildings are being used.
